> What's the rational behind creating test suite out of test methods, 
> and not test classes? JUnit instantiates new object of TestCase for 
> every method (when TestSuite.addTestCase(...) is called), which results 
> in a) a lot of objects being newed, and b) setUp() and tearDown() 
> methods called every time test method is invoked.

answers:
a) does it bother you?
b) acts like specified

the rational is that every test must be independant from the others.  If 
you create one object per test (i.e. test method), you don't have side 
effects between the tests.

> In this case I need to instantiate app container (which 
> would be set up) only once, before I start running multiple test 
> classes. Objects created in "set up" are shared by test classes, and 
> don't need to be created every time test method is called.

Use TestSetup to execute a setup method once before each test of a 
TestCase is executed.
